title: Bandbox, 1840–60
provenance: From the Estate of William Lyman Campbell of Judge Loveland Munson Home- stead, U.S. Route 7, Manchester Village, Vermont.
description: Light, clean bright colors on yellow ground, enframed by white lace-like pattern, vignettes in pink and green depicting winged cupid shooting arrows at a bulls-eye target, behind which classically-draped maiden sits, watching; tree in background. This scene alternates with large bouquet of pink roses tied with pink ribbon. Rim fragments: Yellow background, white and deep pink lines and circles with green dots.

tombstone.epitaph: Bandbox, 1840–60. Block-printed paper, pasteboard support, newspaper. 1967-2-1-a/d.
